magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Heavy white clouds of swirling smoke fill the sky, and it rains ash that coats everything in little flecks. A smell of burning wood or sulphur permeates the air.

Also has the the effect of @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.QeEVRdRfl0Hwf4B2]{Heavy Clouds}

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
At the end of every hour spend in a Blizzard, make a DC 12 Constitution saving. On failure, you take [[/r 3d4 #cold damage]] cold damage and gain one level of exhaustion. You make this check with advantage if you have proper gear.

All creatures are heavily obscured if they are more than 20 feet from you. All terrain is difficult terrain. Also has the effect of @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.tdHrdzk3iiH3ey8k]{Snow}, @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.SJOG1eCJndgc6YcI]{High Winds}, and @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.vCY8oIeUdhZpjUhX]{Freezing Cold}.

Replace with @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.UbDXYzXLQHzMAPIE]{Thunderstorm} when in climates without snow.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: Clear bright light during day time, view of the stars and moon at night.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
If you attempt to take a long rest without cover and heat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw gain the benefits for a long rest. If you fail by 5 or more, you gain an additional level of Exhaustion.

All cold damage rolls have a +2.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: The sky is blocked. High flying aerial creatures have total cover, and outdoor light does not count as sunlight (for the purposes of sunlight sensitivity and similar traits). Checks using Navigation Tools to determine your location based on celestial observation are made with disadvantage.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Same as rain, but the DC becomes 16 to benefit from a long rest without shelter and if Heavy Rain occurs two days in a row wagon travel becomes impossible until one day without rain occurs. May cause flooding. All fire damage rolls have a –4. Lightning and Cold damage rolls gain a +2.

Also has the effect of @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.QeEVRdRfl0Hwf4B2]{Heavy Clouds}.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Turbulent gusts sweep across the land. Select a wind direction based on locale or roll a [[/r 1d4 #Wind Direction: 1 - North, 2 - East, 3 - South, 4 - West]] and consult the table. Flying creatures gain +10 movement speed when moving with the wind, and –10 movement speed when moving against it. All ranged weapon attacks have a –2 to attack rolls, and their range is reduced by half when shooting into the wind.

d4 Direction
1 North
2 East
3 South
4 West

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: Clear bright light during day time, view of the stars and moon at night.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: Has the effects of a Thunderstorm, but the lightning seems to seek creatures out. While outside during this storm, roll a [[/r 1d20 #1: you are attacked by an air elemental, 2-5: struck by lighting bolt dealing 3d12 damage]] every 1 hour you outside without shelter. On a 2-5, you are struck by a lightning bolt dealing [[/r 3d12 #lightning damage]] lightning damage. On a 1, you are attacked by an air elemental.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Stars begin to fall from the sky as lumps of stone and metal. All creatures gain 1 luck point as per the Lucky feat, which lasts until used or the weather changes.

If you travel 4 or more hours outdoors through this weather, roll a [[/r 1d100]]. On a 1, a meteor strikes nearby, leaving [[/r 40d6]] of devastation in it's wake, but perhaps you'll find something cool. Potential consequences: [[/r 2d12 #shockwave damage]] damage from the shock wave, difficult terrain, or heavily obscuring dust clouds.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Unpleasant to travel in. If you have wagons, your travel pace is slowed by half. If you attempt to take a long rest without cover, you must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw gain the benefits for a long rest. All fire damage rolls have a –2.

Also has the effect of @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.QeEVRdRfl0Hwf4B2]{Heavy Clouds}.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Blistering heat that is unpleasant to travel in. Creatures that attempt to travel during day light hours require twice the ration of water, and creature that travel for 4 or more hours or engage in heavy activity for 1 or more hour during the day and do not immediately take a short or long rest under cover must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain a level of Exhaustion.

All fire damage rolls have a +2. All cold damage rolls have a –2.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Unpleasant to travel in. All travel speed is halved. If snow occurs for two days in row, all terrain is difficult terrain and wagon travel is impossible until one day without snow passes.

Also has the the effect of @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.QeEVRdRfl0Hwf4B2]{Heavy Clouds} and @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.vCY8oIeUdhZpjUhX]{Freezing Cold}.

Replace with @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.Lt1CSKq515uB6CMn]{Rain} when in climates without snow.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: For 1 hour during the day, it becomes night. Either select a dramatic time or roll a [[/r 1d12]] for the hour. May or may not have prophetic ramifications.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: Strange swirling lights fill the sky, swirls of green, blue, and purple. Night becomes dim (strangely hued) light until the effect ends.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
The world is a magical and weird place. Something odd occurs today, rarely seen. If you have an effect in mind, use that. If not, draw from the following list for some somewhat generic events. Not all of these will be appropriate for your world and setting, select one that fits or roll  [[/r 1d6]] on the following table.

d6 Phenomena
1 @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.EiSwX1Anep4fgpRV]{Ashfall}
2 @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.SbYAGkmUo2DbRwgi]{Solar Eclipse}
3 @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.gGiSGN0RzkkbriiN]{Strange Lights}
4 @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.O4sL4K29v2kQogWN]{Meteor Shower}
5 @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.0LkA2xxr5Cmer0iR]{Malevolent Storm}
6 @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.lbd26yCMN1QoGOQ2]{Wild Magic Storm}

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: Fluctuations in the weave drive strange flashing lights and odd phenomena sweeping across the world. Rain falls upwards, plants bloom unseasonable, and people see apparitions of the dead and gone. High chance of encounters with sentient plants, ghosts, and strange illusions. All spells cast are naturally upcast by 1 level, but trigger a Wild Surge as per a Wild Magic Sorcerer class feature until the storm subsides (or a table of similar effects including apparitions, illusions, and magical mishaps).

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Lightning flashes and thunder crashes. All creatures are partially obscured if they are more than 20 feet from you.

If you travel for 4 or more hours during a Thunderstorm, roll a [[/r 1d20 #On a 1, you are struck by a lightning bolt dealing 3d12 lightning damage.]]. On a 1, you are struck by a lightning bolt dealing [[/r 3d12 #lightning damage]] lightning damage.

Lightning and Thunder damage rolls have a +2.

Also has the effect of @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.Lt1CSKq515uB6CMn]{Rain}, @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.SJOG1eCJndgc6YcI]{High Winds}, and @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.weather-effects.QeEVRdRfl0Hwf4B2]{Heavy Clouds}.
